title: Brown Bear's Nightlight
description: Brown Bear learns about comfort and facing fears with the help of his glowing nightlight.

pages.text: Brown Bear felt a little scared of the dark as the sun went down.
Shadows danced on the walls, and the wind made gentle whooshing sounds.
He hugged his favorite blanket and looked for his nightlight.
Mom plugged in the nightlight, and a soft, golden glow filled the room.
Brown Bear watched the light make friendly shapes on the ceiling.
He imagined the shapes were stars, animals, and magical lands.
Rabbit came to visit and said, 'Sometimes I get scared too.'
Together, they made up stories about the shapes in the light.
Owl hooted from outside, 'The night is full of gentle sounds and safe dreams.'
Brown Bear listened to the crickets and the soft rustle of leaves.
He realized the night was not so scary with friends and a warm light nearby.
Mom read a bedtime story about a brave bear who faced his fears.
Brown Bear felt braver, knowing he was not alone.
He turned the nightlight brighter and saw his favorite toy bear smiling back.
Rabbit shared a secret: 'When I'm scared, I take a deep breath and think of happy things.'
Brown Bear tried it and felt his worries float away.
He snuggled under his blanket, the nightlight glowing softly beside him.
The shadows turned into friendly shapes, and the room felt safe and warm.
Brown Bear closed his eyes, listening to the gentle sounds of the night.
He dreamed of adventures in magical lands, always with his nightlight by his side.
When he woke up, the sun was shining, and he felt proud for being brave.
Brown Bear knew he could face the dark again, with his nightlight and friends to help.
The lesson: Comfort and courage can turn fears into dreams, and you are never alone in the dark.
